content: >http://blog.wired.com/27bstroke6/2009/04/congresswoman-h.html Long-term congresswoman Jane Harmon has come down on the side of the angels after getting herself caught on a 'legal' wiretap associated with another Israeli spying investigation. After spending the last 8 years telling Americans that their security required their government to intercept and scrutinize electronic communications with, or without judicial approval, the congresswoman is now crying foul on even the legal ones. Congresswoman Harmon was caught on a phone conversation promising to use her influence in the case against two men accused of spying for Israel. She is quoted closing the call with, "This conversation never happened."
reply: >http://blog.wired.com/27bstroke6/2009/04/congresswoman-h.html Long-term congresswoman Jane Harmon has come down on the side of the angels after getting herself caught on a 'legal' wiretap associated with another Israeli spying investigation. Congresswoman Harmon was caught on a phone conversation promising to use her influence in the case against two men accused of spying for Israel. She is quoted closing the call with, "This conversation never happened."
title: Looking Out for Your Best Interest
